thread.title: 5 things to do in Whangarei this winter
thread.title_full: 5 things to do in Whangarei this winter

title: 5 things to do in Whangarei this winter
text:
5 things to do in Whangarei this winter Last updated 05:00, July 5 2015 Nick Unkovich/Fairfax NZ 
A rainbow greets Hatea Loop walkers in Whangarei's Town Basin area. 
A quick escape north of Auckland for the colder months. 
1 Bridge the gap 
About two hours drive from Auckland, Whangarei is ideal for a weekend break, or as a base for exploring the wider district. Check out the city's new riverside walkway, the 4.2km Hatea Loop, which connects the CBD's main attractions via pedestrian bridges. 
2 Tackle the trail 
Take a harbourside stroll in the Town Basin precinct for an insight into local arts and heritage. Attractions on the Sculpture & Heritage Trail include the Whangarei Art Museum, Claphams Clock Museum and Reyburn House Art Gallery. 
3 Enjoy the view 
Head up Mt Parihaka, the volcanic cone which dominates Whangarei's skyline, for views of the city and the rugged peaks of Whangarei Heads. 
4 Free fall 
Visit the Whangarei Falls by heading 5km from the city centre on the Tutukaka Coast Highway. Take the short loop track through native forest to the base of the 26 metre waterfall, or enjoy the view from three easy-access viewing platforms. 
5 Take on Tutukaka 
This jaw-dropping coastline is not just a summer destination. Head up for the Tutukaka Coast Winter Festival (14-29 August) - the programme includes a raft race, drive-in movies, dragonboat regatta, fishing competitions and a craft beer fest. 
See whangareinz.com for more information. - Stuff
